str2: Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Adam, the first man, the first parent of the human race. Of Hebrew origin; Adam, the first man; typically man.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To make that which was dead to live, cause to live, quicken. From the same as zoon and poieo; tovitalize.
